jobs.title: Principal QA Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Who We Are

Ontic provides software that helps corporate and government security teams identify threats, assess risk, and respond faster to keep people and organizations safe. Its Connected Intelligence Platform unifies security operations and data into a centralized system of record, enabling organizations to conduct risk assessments, protect against workplace violence, and manage threats and incidents more efficiently. Fortune 500 companies and federal agencies rely on Ontic to support security programs such as executive protection, threat intelligence, and corporate investigations.

Learn more at ontic.co or follow us on LinkedIn.

Key Responsibilities

Develop and implement robust manual and automated testing strategies across the full
technology stack.
Drive test planning, estimation, and risk mitigation across multiple releases while collaborating
with engineering, product, and DevOps teams.
Design scalable test automation scripts and expand coverage across UI, API, and data layers for efficient and reliable testing.
Embed automated tests within CI/CD pipelines to support fast, high-quality releases and
continuous feedback.
Manage the full QA lifecycle, including test documentation, defect tracking, and release sign-offs, using industry-standard tools.
Define and monitor quality KPIs to ensure visibility, accountability, and continuous improvement in testing practices.
Guide junior engineers on test automation, agile QA processes, and instill a quality-first
engineering culture.
Work independently while proactively sharing progress, highlighting risks, and keeping
stakeholders informed throughout the QA lifecycle.

Knowledge and Technical Skills

Bring 7+ years of QA experience in SaaS or product-based environments with a degree in
Computer Science or related field.
Possess deep knowledge of functional, regression, integration, performance, and end-to-end
testing principles.
Skilled in tools such as Selenium, Cypress, Playwright, Postman, REST Assured, TestNG, and
scripting with Python, Java, or JavaScript.
Proficient in CI/CD systems like Jenkins, GitHub Actions, or GitLab CI, with hands-on Docker and Kubernetes exposure.
Experienced with TestRail, JIRA, Xray, Allure, and observability tools like Kibana, Grafana, or
Datadog.
Comfortable testing in AWS, GCP, or Azure environments, with practical use of MongoDB,
PostgreSQL, MySQL, or Redis.
Well-versed in Agile/Scrum workflows, with a strong track record in cross-functional, iterative
product development.
Strong analytical mindset, excellent communication skills, and a proactive approach to leading
quality across teams.

Ontic provides software that helps corporate and government security teams identify threats, assess risk, and respond faster to keep people and organizations safe. Its Connected Intelligence Platform unifies security operations and data into a centralized system of record, enabling organizations to conduct risk assessments, protect against workplace violence, and manage threats and incidents more efficiently. Fortune 500 companies and federal agencies rely on Ontic to support security programs such as executive protection, threat intelligence, and corporate investigations.

Learn more at ontic.co or follow us on LinkedIn.

Who You Are

Ontic is seeking a Strategic Account Manager (SAM) who excels at uncovering growth opportunities within existing enterprise client accounts. In this revenue-focused role, you will be responsible for driving expansion (75%) and ensuring retention (25%) across a defined portfolio of Fortune 1000 clients. You will act as a trusted strategic partner to your accounts, leveraging deep industry insight and Ontic’s platform capabilities to grow revenue and deliver lasting client value.

You’re commercially driven and results-oriented, with a strong ability to identify upsell and cross-sell opportunities while also building long-term, consultative relationships that support client goals.

Responsibilities

  • Own a revenue quota tied to growth from existing client accounts.

  • Develop and execute account growth strategies, uncovering upsell and cross-sell opportunities through proactive engagement.

  • Build and maintain a strong opportunity pipeline to regularly meet or exceed revenue targets.

  • Cultivate relationships with multiple stakeholders and serve as a consultative sales leader within your accounts, driving expansion and adoption of new modules, features, and services.

  • Partner closely with internal teams (Solutions Engineers, Product, Customer Success) to deliver tailored proposals and close expansion deals.

  • Monitor account health, proactively identify risks, and collaborate with internal stakeholders to mitigate churn.

  • Achieve the quarterly and annual revenue targets set by the company and manage and document pipeline and forecast in Salesforce.

  • Constantly look for ways to enhance your knowledge of our industry, market, and competitors to provide the sales edge needed to close business and generate revenue.

  • Represent Ontic as a domain and product expert at client interactions, industry and corporate events, and through community sites and social media.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Five-plus years of experience in enterprise account management or strategic sales, ideally within a SaaS or B2B tech environment.

  • Demonstrated success in hitting or exceeding revenue growth targets through expansion sales.

  • Ability to navigate complex organizational structures, long sales cycles, and multiple decision-makers.

  • Assertive hunter mentality adept in identifying and winning new business.

Who We Are

Ontic provides software that helps corporate and government security teams identify threats, assess risk, and respond faster to keep people and organizations safe. Its Connected Intelligence Platform unifies security operations and data into a centralized system of record, enabling organizations to conduct risk assessments, protect against workplace violence, and manage threats and incidents more efficiently. Fortune 500 companies and federal agencies rely on Ontic to support security programs such as executive protection, threat intelligence, and corporate investigations.

Learn more at ontic.co or follow us on LinkedIn.

Who You Are

As a Senior Technical Account Manager at Ontic, you are the dedicated technical quarterback for a defined portfolio of enterprise clients. You take deep architectural ownership of each tenant, ensuring every environment is healthy, secure, and optimized so that technical friction never impedes business value. Partnering closely with Client Success Managers and Managed Services Specialists, you advise on best-practice configuration, rapidly diagnose issues, and guide long-term platform strategy to align with each customer’s security and risk-intelligence goals. You also act as the critical conduit between client technical teams and Ontic Product & Engineering, translating field-level requirements into clear, actionable product feedback and roadmap inputs.

Responsibilities

  • Strategic Technical Partnership: Serve as a senior technical advisor to enterprise clients, developing deep knowledge of their architecture, business objectives, and long-term roadmap to ensure alignment.

  • Platform Architecture & Guidance: Provide senior-level consultation on system design, data flows, integrations, and APIs to maximize performance, reliability, and scalability. Anticipate production-impacting risks by reviewing upcoming client events and technical plans.

  • Executive & Cross-Functional Communication: Translate complex technical concepts into business-aligned recommendations for executive and technical stakeholders. Serve as a key liaison across Success, Services, Product, Engineering, and Support to drive resolution and roadmap alignment.

  • Technical Workshop Facilitation: Lead roadmap alignment discussions, enablement sessions, and advanced troubleshooting workshops with client IT, security, and engineering teams.

  • Technical Health Reviews: Conduct monthly or quarterly reviews focused on key technical health metrics, areas of risk, and performance trends. Deliver clear, actionable recommendations and co-develop roadmaps with clients to improve outcomes.

  • Escalation Ownership & Risk Mitigation: Own and drive resolution of escalated technical issues, coordinating resources across departments and applying sound judgment to avoid risk and preserve client trust.

  • Automation & Optimization: Identify opportunities for automation through scripting, workflow design, or API utilization to drive client efficiency and scale.

  • Technical Best Practices: Become an expert in Ontic’s platform and demonstrate deep understanding of internal best practices and how they drive better client outcomes. Ensure clients are informed, aligned, and actively implementing these practices.

  • Travel: Participate in quarterly travel for client engagement, internal collaboration, and strategic planning.

  • Build realistic workload models including concurrency, think time, data mix, caching, spike/soak patterns, and canary strategies.

  • Define environment parity and test data strategies to ensure credible results.

  • Design scalable JMeter scripts with correlation, parameterization, data feeders, and custom logic (JSR223).

  • Execute load, stress, spike, endurance/soak, capacity, and baseline tests across services and UI/API layers.

  • Create reusable components/utilities to speed up authoring and reduce maintenance effort.

  • Integrate performance suites into CI/CD pipelines (Jenkins/GitHub Actions) with automated thresholds and budgets.

  • Establish performance release gates (pass/fail criteria, canary checks, rollback triggers) and lead go/no-go decisions.

  • Perform bottleneck analysis (CPU, GC, threads, DB query plans, caches, Kafka/queues, downstream dependencies).

  • Validate environment configurations (instance types, autoscaling, TLS, caches) and eliminate client-side bottlenecks.

  • Enforce warm-ups, steady-state validation, and repeatability, flagging any noise sources.

  • Maintain baselines and flakiness detection for performance test results.

  • Lead/mentor a small team when required (code reviews, coaching, establishing standards).

  • Collaborate with Dev, DevOps, DBA, and SRE teams on triage, tuning, and verifying fixes.

  • Solid knowledge of HTTP/REST, TLS, concurrency, caching, connection pooling, and asynchronous patterns.

  • Proven experience integrating performance tests into CI/CD and enforcing SLO/threshold-based gates.

  • Skilled with APM/observability tools and infra/DB analysis (GC, heap, thread dumps, slow queries).

  • Scripting experience in Java, Groovy, or Python for utilities, data generation, and JMeter extensions.

  • Strong communication skills with the ability to translate data into insights and influence release outcomes.

  • Exposure to cloud platforms (AWS/GCP/Azure) and container environments (Docker, Kubernetes).

  • Experience with protocols (gRPC, WebSocket) and Kafka throughput/latency testing.

  • Strong understanding of DB performance (indexing, query plans, connection limits across MySQL/Postgres/NoSQL).

  • Experience with service virtualization and synthetic data platforms.

We are seeking an experienced Technical Program Management Director (Contract-to-Hire) with a specialized focus on Dedicated deployments to lead and oversee our dedicated deployment initiatives across the United States.

The ideal candidate will bring a deep, hands-on understanding of DevOps infrastructure, strategic planning, implementation, and delivery models—particularly in large-scale environments. This individual will play a critical role in shaping and executing our DevOps strategy, driving operational excellence, and ensuring alignment between engineering, product, and customer success teams.

Success in this role requires exceptional technical, communication, analytical, and project management skills, along with the ability to operate effectively in a dynamic, client-focused environment. While initial responsibilities will center on specific client deployments, the scope will expand over time to include additional enterprise customers within this domain.


Key Responsibilities

  • Build and lead a small team of Technical Program Managers (TPMs) to support dedicated deployments and ensure the smooth, reliable delivery of releases for client customers.

  • Lead technical program management for the delivery and lifecycle management of releases into dedicated client or agency instances, particularly where isolation, specialized configurations, heightened compliance, or custom integrations are required.

  • Oversee the strategy and execution of the dedicated deployments release process, managing cross-functional coordination, ensuring security, compliance, and operational standards are met, and delivering a seamless experience for enterprise and government clients.

  • Collaborate with engineering, DevOps, product, and operations teams to ensure releases are high-quality, timely, and aligned with Ontic’s overall product and cloud SaaS roadmap.

  • Develop a long-term playbook and roadmap for success to continuously improve delivery models, operational efficiency, and customer satisfaction across dedicated deployments.

Skills & Qualifications

  • Strong technical background with a hands-on understanding of DevOps principles, infrastructure management, and deployment models in both multi-tenant and dedicated client environments.

  • Proven ability to manage complex technical programs, balancing ongoing project execution with evolving scope and emerging technical challenges.

  • Experience operationalizing deployment strategies, including developing playbooks, roadmaps, and scalable best practices for infrastructure, DevOps engagement, and release management.

  • Expertise in ensuring security, compliance, and operational readiness, particularly in high-stakes client environments involving API integrations, data encryption, and infrastructure readiness. Familiarity with security practices (vulnerability scanning, application & infrastructure patching, incident response, encryption, BYOK, IAM)

  • Demonstrated success in requirements gathering and discovery with potential clients to evaluate deployment suitability and design tailored implementation plans.

  • Skilled in project management of technical initiatives, including risk assessment, mitigation planning, and contingency development for enterprise deployments.

  • Proven ability to translate complex technical information into clear, actionable business terms for non-technical stakeholders, enabling faster and better-informed decision-making.

  • Strong stakeholder management and communication skills, with experience coordinating across multiple teams (Sales, Engineering, DevOps, Client Success, and Account Management) to deliver on key milestones.

  • Ability to reduce operational load on technical teams by owning program management, stakeholder communications, and alignment of technical execution with business priorities.

Preferred Experience

  • 12+ years of experience in Technical Program Management, with at least 5 years leading complex DevOps or infrastructure-focused initiatives.

  • Prior experience working in a SaaS, cloud infrastructure, or enterprise software environment.

  • Strong familiarity with AWS, Azure, or GCP cloud environments and related DevOps tools (e.g., Kubernetes, Terraform, Jenkins, GitHub Actions, etc.).

  • Experience managing dedicated deployments for enterprise or government clients, with a deep understanding of compliance and data protection requirements (e.g., FedRAMP, SOC 2, ISO 27001).

  • Background in program governance, release management, and cross-functional leadership across distributed teams.

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or a related technical field; advanced degree a plus.

Ideal Candidate Attributes

  • Brings passion and energy to thrive in a fast-paced environment under cross-functional pressures.

You’re a purpose-driven marketing leader who believes company mission matters — and Ontic’s mission to help keep people safe deeply resonates with you. You’re also a builder and a collaborator — the kind of leader who works shoulder-to-shoulder with Sales to drive pipeline growth. You understand the challenges of building territories and closing business, and you help your team bring the same empathy and partnership mindset to every engagement.

You operate comfortably at both the strategic and detailed levels. You stay close enough to understand the details but give your team the space to own their work. You set a clear vision, ask smart questions, and know when to dive in and when to step back. You empower your team to own their work — coaching them to grow, challenging them to think bigger, and celebrating their wins. Developing people is one of the most fulfilling parts of your job, and you make time for it.

You believe in the power of community and trust. Ontic’s reputation has been built through word of mouth — by earning credibility, not buying it — and you’re energized by the challenge of scaling that trust through creative, measurable programs that blend digital precision with human connection.

On the Ontic Marketing team, our rallying cry is “Marketing leads the way.” To us, it means being early adopters, trying new things, and showing what good looks like — because for many, marketing is their first experience of Ontic. You share that spirit. The idea that marketing can set the tone for how a company shows up in the world resonates deeply with you. You lead with clarity and curiosity, building a marketing organization that experiments boldly, learns fast, and always keeps its focus on one thing: creating pipeline that drives growth.

Responsibilities

  • Develop and execute a comprehensive revenue marketing strategy that aligns demand generation, field marketing, and events to Ontic’s pipeline and growth objectives.

  • Foster a collaborative relationship with Sales, helping both teams operate as one unified pipeline engine.

  • Model the Ontic Marketing ethos of “Marketing leads the way” — being early adopters, trying new things, and showing what great looks like across channels and experiences.

  • Invest in your team’s growth: recruit exceptional talent, provide ongoing coaching, and celebrate achievement.

  • Maintain high standards for creativity, data discipline, and executional excellence while encouraging experimentation and learning.

  • Creativity with discipline: You’ll create high-ROI frameworks that allow for experimentation, learning, and iteration — ensuring the team stays both inventive and accountable.

  • Mission at the center: You’ll help a marketing organization mature into a high-performing, data-driven growth engine without losing its connection to Ontic’s mission — helping to keep people safe.

We’re looking for a Senior Director of Product Design to lead, scale, and evolve our product design function into a world-class capability. You’ll be both player and coach—setting vision, creating frameworks, and rolling up your sleeves when needed.

Responsibilities

  • Lead the Design Function For Products: Manage and mentor a growing team of product designers and UX researchers. Establish clear career paths and performance standards.

  • AI Focus: Ability to use AI in practice and design for AI.

  • Drive Design Strategy: Define a long-term design vision and roadmap that aligns with company objectives, customer needs, and product strategy.

  • Elevate Design Quality: Champion a consistent design language and user experience across the product portfolio. Raise the bar on usability, accessibility, and delight.

  • Contribute To The Design Systems: Work in partnership with the Director of Design, Platforms to build and implement scalable design systems, processes, and tooling to enable consistency and efficiency as we scale.

  • Be a Cross-Functional Leader: Collaborate deeply with Product, Engineering, Marketing, and Customer Success to ensure design is integrated across the product lifecycle.

  • Advocate for the User: Embed user research and feedback into the product development cycle. Cultivate a culture of human-centered design.

Preferred Qualifications

  • 10+ years of experience in product design, including 3+ years in a senior design leadership role at a growth-stage B2B SaaS company.

  • Proven success building, mentoring, and scaling high-performing design teams.

  • A strong design portfolio that shows end-to-end product thinking and measurable business impact.

  • Experience maturing design processes in a scrappy, growth environment.

  • Deep understanding of user research methodologies and data-informed design.

  • Ability to balance design vision with practical product and business constraints.

  • Clear, confident communication and a collaborative, low-ego leadership style.
